lines.gurmukhi: kaUAw jau mrwl sBw jwie bYTy mwnsr duicq audws bws Aws durgMD kI
lines.transliteration_english: Kaooaa Jau Maraal Sabhaa Jaai Baitthay Maanasara , Douchit Udaas Baas Aas Duragandh Kee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If a crow joins the company of swans on the bank of lake Mansarover (a sacred lake in Himalayas) he will feel morose and in two minds since he cannot find any sullage there.

lines.gurmukhi: s√çwn ijau bYTweIAY suBg pRjMg pwr iqAwig jwie cwkI cwtY hIn mq AMD kI
lines.transliteration_english: Svaan Jiu Baitthaaeeai Soubhag Prajang Paara , Tiaagi Jaai Chaakee Chaatai Heen Mat Andh Kee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a dog is made to sit on a comfortable bed, being of base wisdom and foolish he will leave it and go to lick millstone.

lines.gurmukhi: grDb AMg Argjw jau lypn kIjY lotq Bsm sMig hY kutyv kMD kI
lines.transliteration_english: Garadhab Ang Aragajaa Jau Laypan Keejai , Lotat Bhasam Sangi Hai Koutayv Kandh Kee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If a donkey is applied with paste of sandalwood, saffron and musk etc., he will still go and roll in the dust as is his character.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy hI AswD swDsMgiq n pRIiq cIiq mnsw aupwD AprwD snbMD kI ]386]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Hee Asaadh Saadhasangati N Preeti Cheeti , Manasaa Oupaadh Aparaadh Sanabandh Kee ?386?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, those of base wisdom and turned away from the True Guru have no love or attraction for the company of saintly persons. They are ever engrossed in creating troubles and doing ill deeds.  (386)
